Content: Schafer: Well, I'm in an interesting position now because I'm running the company and I'm running a project.
Content_zh: Schafer：嗯，我現在處於一個有趣的位置，因為我在經營公司，同時也在管理一個項目。

Content: So on the one hand I'm just, I'm equal to the other project leaders and I can't really abuse my ability to like pick up resource up
Content_zh: 所以一方面我只是，我和其他項目負責人一樣，我不能真正濫用我的能力去獲取資源

Content: and put them on a different project.
Content_zh: 並將他們分配到不同的項目。

Content: But I do when they're not looking, so that's fine.
Content_zh: 但當他們沒注意時，我會這麼做，所以沒問題。

Content: All for the good of the project.
Content_zh: 都是為了項目的利益。

Content: Team Member: Ostensibly, we going to take somebody off your team to put them on DFA.
Content_zh: 團隊成員：表面上，我們將從你的團隊中抽調某人到DFA。

Content: And you're going to be short-handed.
Content_zh: 然後你的人手會變少。

Content: Schafer: I mean when you're project leader, you have to kind of fight for your team.
Content_zh: Schafer：我的意思是，當你是項目負責人時，你必須為你的團隊而戰。

Content: I mean, it's a fight for resources.
Content_zh: 我的意思是，這是一場資源的爭奪。

Content: And you care about the company overall but you still know that to make your game good you should get the best people on it.
Content_zh: 你關心整個公司的利益，但你依然知道，要做好你的遊戲，你應該讓最優秀的人參與其中。

Content: And so you kind of, you have to do a little recruiting.
Content_zh: 所以你需要進行一些招聘。

Content: You have to talk to them, you know, outside of meetings and stuff and be like, hey, are you interested?
Content_zh: 你必須與他們溝通，知道的，在會議之外，然後說，“嘿，你有興趣嗎？”

Content: I think we know you'd be, this would be a good opportunity to you.
Content_zh: 我覺得我們知道你會覺得這對你而言是一個好機會。

Content: You could, you know, you'd be moving up or you'd be taking on more responsibility or we're doing this really cool kind of art or something like that.
Content_zh: 你可以，知道的，你將會晉升或承擔更多責任，或者我們會做一些非常酷的藝術之類的。

Content: Get people excited about it.
Content_zh: 讓人們對此感到興奮。

Content: And mostly we just said that we're doing this project and most people like Anna and Brandon, you know,
Content_zh: 而且我們大部分時候只是說我們在做這個項目，大多數人像Anna和Brandon，知道的，

Content: mentioned to me they wanted to work on it.
Content_zh: 向我提到他們想參與其中。

Content: Dillon: I mean I was big gamer when I was a kid.
Content_zh: Dillon：我是說，我小時候是個重度遊戲玩家。

Content: But like adventure games were always kind of special to me in particular.
Content_zh: 但冒險遊戲對我來說總是特別的。

Content: The fact that I wound up, you know, in a configuration where I could get to work on an adventure game with, you know,
Content_zh: 事實上，我最終處於一個能與……一起開發冒險遊戲的環境中，知道的，

Content: with my favorite adventure game designer.
Content_zh: 與我最喜愛的冒險遊戲設計師一起。

Content: It's just crazy and still kind of mind-boggling.
Content_zh: 這真是太瘋狂，仍然讓人難以置信。

Content: Schafer: And because the schedule is so tight on DFA and it's got such a small budget, that's, that is a bit of worry, too.
Content_zh: Schafer：而且因為DFA的時間表如此緊湊，預算又如此有限，這也是有點讓人擔心。

Content_zh: Schafer：不過我有點緊張。螢幕外的聲音：你為什麼緊張？

Content_zh: Schafer：因為我真的很想要Brandon加入團隊。

Content: And so do the other teams.
Content_zh: 其他團隊也是如此。

Content: So if he does something really awesome, I'm just going to get sad if we then don't get him on the team.
Content_zh: 所以如果他做了非常棒的事情，如果我們之後沒有讓他加入團隊，我會感到難過。

Content_zh: Dillon：所以基本上，週末我只是想原型化一些工具的工作。

Content: I didn't get around to it.

Content: Schafer: Oh my God.
Content_zh: Schafer：天啊。

Content_zh: Schafer：對。現在點擊那邊的外空。Dillon：沒問題。

Content: Brandon is a genius and a great programmer and also someone who has like a deep love,

Content: a deeper understanding of the low level systems required but also a real affinity for adventure games and tools and pipeline.

Content: Dillon: So like this is honestly the stuff that I'm most excited about, right.
Content_zh: Dillon：所以說，這真的是我最興奮的事情，對吧。

Content: It's like, you know, coming up with a tool chain for everybody to use, where like, you know, whatever crazy idea that Tim has, we can get it into the game
Content_zh: 這就像，知道的，為每個人設計一個工具鏈，無論Tim有什麼瘋狂的想法，我們都可以將其加入遊戲中，

Content: as quickly as possible and actually see whether or not it works.
Content_zh: 盡可能快地，並實際看看它是否有效。

Content: And tune it up so that it can be as good as it can be.
Content_zh: 然後進行調整，使其達到最佳效果。

Content: I like being behind the scenes.

Content: Schafer: That's crazy, OK. Programming is actually happening, on the game All right, you guys.
Content_zh: Schafer：那太瘋狂了，好的。程式編寫實際上正在進行中，遊戲正在製作中，好的，大家。

Content: Awesome. That's cool. We're actually doing actual work.
Content_zh: 太棒了。這很酷。我們實際上正在做真正的工作。

Content: Schafer: I Probably should go design it now.
Content_zh: Schafer：我可能應該現在去設計它了。

Content: Dillon: It's really nice to just get something on the screen and like that's always the first step to, like it's very clarifying
Content_zh: Dillon：把東西放在螢幕上真的很好，而且這總是第一步，就像是一個非常清晰的過程，

Content: to, you know, have stuff present and actually interactive, because then it's easy to figure out what to do next basically.
Content_zh: 知道的，有東西展示並且實際可互動，因為這樣基本上就很容易弄清楚下一步該做什麼。

Content: Rice: Oliver. Franzke: Hello!
Content_zh: Rice：Oliver。Franzke：你好！

Content: What have you got, man?
Content_zh: 你有什麼，兄弟？

Content: Franzke: It's pretty cool.
Content_zh: Franzke：這很酷。

Content: Rice: This is the game?
Content_zh: Rice：這是遊戲？

Content: Franzke: It's kind of a game. Rice: Oh nice! Walking in 3-D space.
Content_zh: Franzke：這算是一個遊戲。Rice：哦，真棒！在3D空間中行走。

Content: Franzke: Well, it's like scaling it vertically, but that's, that's pretty much how we're going to do it in the final game as well.
Content_zh: Franzke：嗯，就像垂直縮放，但這差不多也是我們在最終遊戲中打算怎麼做的。

Content: Rice: So all these are flat planes and you're just scaling the size of the character?
Content_zh: Rice：所以這些都是平面，你只是縮放角色的大小？

Content: Rice: And then we've got Oliver and he's doing a lot of system work on the engine and getting the engine kind of in shape.
Content_zh: Rice：然後我們有Oliver，他在引擎上做了很多系統工作，並讓引擎處於良好狀態。

Content: Franzke: Well I was born in Germany of course i'm from Germany.
Content_zh: Franzke：嗯，我當然是在德國出生的，我來自德國。

Content: In fact, from East Germany.
Content_zh: 事實上，來自東德。

Content: So because of historic reasons I can be here today, otherwise I would probably be in Moscow right now, I guess.
Content_zh: 所以由於歷史原因，我今天才能在這裡，否則我現在可能正在莫斯科，我猜。

Content: I'd probably follow the people that work in the industry, like from a young age, you know, I always was playing games and was interested in the medium.
Content_zh: 我可能會追隨那些在這行工作的人，從小我就一直在玩遊戲，對這種媒介感興趣。

Content: It's certainly kind of strange to be here now, to actually write adventure game from scratch.
Content_zh: 現在能在這裡從零開始編寫冒險遊戲，當然有點奇怪。

Content: It's kind of cool, I guess it's what a lot of people in the gaming industry kind of dream about
Content_zh: 這有點酷，我猜這是許多遊戲行業的人夢寐以求的，

Content: and would love to do and it's kind of, it's awesome to be here now at this time
Content_zh: 並且他們很想做，現在能在這個時候在這裡，真的很棒，

Content: and like be able to be part of this project, for sure.
Content_zh: 並且能成為這個項目的一部分，肯定的。

Content: It's very exciting.
Content_zh: 這非常令人興奮。

Content: I should probably mention that this is not the final game, so please nobody freak out at this point yet.
Content_zh: 我可能應該提到這不是最終的遊戲，所以請大家暫時不要驚慌。

Content: Schafer: You know, I've never worked with Oliver before directly.
Content_zh: Schafer：你知道，我以前從未直接與Oliver合作過。

Content: He's worked on Once Upon a Monster.
Content_zh: 他曾在《從前有怪獸》中工作過。

Content: And it's funny, he worked on the special edition of Monkey Island back at Lucas.
Content_zh: 有趣的是，他曾在Lucas工作時參與了《猴島奇兵》的特別版。

Content: Also he's German.
Content_zh: 他也是德國人。

Content: Franzke: And if I have time, which would be awesome, like to actually dialogue system so you can initiate like a dialogue with some...
Content_zh: Franzke：如果我有時間，那將會很棒，比如實際的對話系統，這樣你可以發起與某些……的對話。

Content: some other thing in the world.
Content_zh: 世界上的其他東西。

Content: Kipnis: So what we're looking at is an implementation of that, of a dialogue sequencer.
Content_zh: Kipnis：所以我們正在看的就是對話序列器的實現。

Content: We have this database of lines.
Content_zh: 我們有這樣一個台詞數據庫。

Content: So i'm just using that to test out my system.
Content_zh: 所以我只是在用它來測試我的系統。

Content: So I wrote this little test dataset that the red bots are going to insult each other with.
Content_zh: 所以我寫了這個小的測試數據集，紅色機器人將會用它互相侮辱。

Content: And so, yeah, let me show you what it actually looks like when you play it.
Content_zh: 所以，是的，讓我展示一下實際玩起來的樣子。

Content: My friends had Nintendo and that was, that was the best for me.
Content_zh: 我的朋友們有任天堂，那對我來說是最棒的。

Content: Like I remember I played a lot of Super Mario Brothers.
Content_zh: 我記得我玩了很多《超級瑪利歐兄弟》。

Content: And I mean, that kind of blew my mind at the time, because when I was growing up I was kind of the oldest kid.
Content_zh: 我的意思是，那當時真的讓我大開眼界，因為我成長時有點是最年長的孩子。

Content: And I would come up with games to play with everyone else to entertain them and stuff.
Content_zh: 我會想出一些遊戲來和其他人一起玩，娛樂他們之類的。

Content: And I realized when I played Super Mario Brothers that this was kind of the same thing.
Content_zh: 然後我意識到，當我玩《超級瑪利歐兄弟》時，這有點像同樣的事情。

Content: Like someone made up like this like little world for other people to experience and to see.
Content_zh: 就像有人為其他人創造了這樣一個小世界來體驗和觀看。

Content: And you didn't even have to be there; And it was just like magical.
Content_zh: 而且你甚至不需要在那裡；這就像是魔法一樣。

Content: It was like magical technology where I can do this stuff that I had been doing as a child.
Content_zh: 這像是魔法般的技術，讓我能做那些我童年時做的事情。

Content: That was like my dream. I got my dream job somehow, basically.
Content_zh: 那就是我的夢想。總的來說，我以某種方式得到了我的夢想工作。

Content: And hopefully on this game, I mean she's... I haven't written a lot of dialogue yet, but she already knows kind of what I'm going to write structurally.
Content_zh: 希望在這個遊戲中，我的意思是她……我還沒寫很多對話，但她已經大致知道我將結構性地寫什麼。

Content: And so she's already writing the systems to implement that.
Content_zh: 所以她已經在寫系統來實現這一點。

Content: Rice: So then we've also got Lee Petty, who is the art director.
Content_zh: Rice：然後我們還有Lee Petty，他是藝術總監。

Content_zh: Petty：除非你有……否則有點難以調整。

Content_zh: Rice：這是舊的，這是新的。

Content: Petty: That's the old one?
Content_zh: Petty：那是舊的？

Content: Rice: This is the old one, yeah.
Content_zh: Rice：這是舊的，對。

Content: Petty: That's a little different than I remember it.
Content_zh: Petty：那和我記得的有點不同。

Content: Petty: I've pretty much been in the game industry since 1996 constantly.
Content_zh: Petty：我幾乎從1996年開始就一直在遊戲行業。

Content: I was at Accolade for about five years.
Content_zh: 我在Accolade工作了大約五年。

Content: I worked on a variety of projects there, some of which shipped, some of which didn't.
Content_zh: 我在那裡參與了各種項目，有些項目發佈了，有些沒有。

Content: I actually was cursed.
Content_zh: 我其實被詛咒了。

Content: I don't remember how many years, but I think it was like my first three years in the industry,
Content_zh: 我不記得多少年了，但我想是我在這行業的前三年，

Content: everything I worked on was cancelled.
Content_zh: 我參與的每一個項目都被取消了。

Content: It was like, ahhh.
Content_zh: 那很沮喪。

Content: I can't get a single game on my resume.
Content_zh: 我的履歷上都沒有一款遊戲。

Content: Luckily games didn't take three years to make each back then, right?
Content_zh: 幸運的是，當時遊戲製作不需要三年一款，對吧？

Content: Schafer: Yeah, Lee's been here for a while.
Content_zh: Schafer：是的，Lee已經在這裡一段時間了。

Content: He was, came in, in the middle of Brutal Legend and took it over and made it look good.
Content_zh: 他在《Brutal Legend》進行到一半時加入，接手並讓它看起來很好。

Content: He's been in the industry for a long time.
Content_zh: 他在這行業已經很久了。

Content: I think if you look at him you can see the, it's a wear on his face from the games industry.
Content_zh: 我覺得如果你看著他，你能看到他臉上的痕跡，這是遊戲行業帶來的。

Content: No, he's worked on the games for a long time.
Content_zh: 不，他已經在遊戲行業工作了很長時間。

Content: He knows, he knows everything.
Content_zh: 他什麼都知道。

Content: He's, you know, he's run his own projects.
Content_zh: 他，知道的，他自己管理過項目。

Content: He ran Stacking all by himself. I didn't get involved in that at all.
Content_zh: 他獨自運營了《Stacking》。我完全沒參與那個。

Content: He wrote the dialogue for it. He did everything.
Content_zh: 他為那個寫了對話。他做了所有事情。

Content: So we're lucky to have him on projects for a little while.
Content_zh: 所以我們很幸運能在項目上有他一段時間。

Content: I'm trying to figure out whether we can steal him for good or not.
Content_zh: 我在試圖弄清楚我們是否能永久挖走他。

Content: But there's so many other things we need him to do.
Content_zh: 但我們還有很多其他事情需要他做。

Content: Don't let him see this footage, though, 'cause he'll ask for a raise.
Content_zh: 不過不要讓他看到這些片段，因為他會要求加薪。

Content: Rice: Yeah. We're starting to get like a team on the game.
Content_zh: Rice：是的。我們開始為遊戲組建一個團隊。

Content: Schafer: This is the nightmare team from hell, you guys.
Content_zh: Schafer：這就是來自地獄的夢魘團隊，夥計們。

Content: You've never seen a sicker, crazier team.
Content_zh: 你們從未見過如此病態、瘋狂的團隊。

Content: Petty: I'm getting Wi-Fi but it's not connecting to the Skype.
Content_zh: Petty：我有Wi-Fi了，但它無法連接到Skype。

Content: Did you, you signed out on purpose, right?
Content_zh: 你是故意登出嗎？對吧？

Content: Rice: Yeah, because it went away.
Content_zh: Rice：是的，因為它消失了。

Content: Petty: Yeah, I don't know what's going on.
Content_zh: Petty：是的，我不知道發生了什麼。

Content: Skype server seemed like they're having issues.
Content_zh: Skype伺服器似乎出了問題。

Content: Schafer: OK, this is the first stand-up. Isn't it exciting?
Content_zh: Schafer：好的，這是第一次站立會議。不是很興奮嗎？

Content: We can't do it without Bagel. You can't get Bagel?
Content_zh: 我們沒有Bagel就做不到。你找不到Bagel嗎？

Content: Rice: Internet's being weird.
Content_zh: Rice：網路有點怪異。

Content: Kipnis: Should we just call him?
Content_zh: Kipnis：我們應該直接打電話給他嗎？

Content: Schafer: Bagel, we're having troubles with Skype.
Content_zh: Schafer：Bagel，我們在Skype上遇到了麻煩。

Content: Can we just speaker-phone you in?
Content_zh: 我們可以用揚聲電話連接你嗎？

Content: Bagel: Yeah, let's do it.
Content_zh: Bagel：是的，讓我們這麼做吧。

Content: Schafer: OK, we're doing it.
Content_zh: Schafer：好的，我們來做。

Content: Rice: Is that all the way up?
Content_zh: Rice：音量開到最響了嗎？

Content: Schafer: That's as loud as it gets.
Content_zh: Schafer：這已經是最大聲音了。

Content: Say hi, Bagel. Bagel: Hey, everybody.
Content_zh: 說聲嗨，Bagel。Bagel：大家好。

Content: Rice: And then we've also got, we've always had Bagel on, doing like concept arts and backgrounds and stuff like that.
Content_zh: Rice：然後我們還有，Bagel一直在做概念藝術和背景之類的東西。

Content: But now we've got an art director on the project that'll actually start trying to take those images that Bagel has made
Content_zh: 但現在我們項目上有了一位藝術總監，會開始嘗試將Bagel製作的那些圖像

Content: and figure out how to actually get them in a game and get them to be like working game assets.
Content_zh: 並弄清楚如何將它們實際地放入遊戲中，讓它們成為運作中的遊戲資產。

Content: Schafer: Bagel Stapley, Nathan.
Content_zh: Schafer：Bagel Stapley，Nathan。

Content: Stapley: Buddy.
Content_zh: Stapley：夥計。

Content: Schafer: Look at that baaaaaaa. Lee Petty is here.
Content_zh: Schafer：看看那個baaaaaaa。李Petty在這裡。

Content: Petty: What's up, Bagel?
Content_zh: Petty：Bagel，怎麼樣？

Content: Schafer: Lee Petoir is here.
Content_zh: Schafer：李Petty在這裡。

Content: Stapley: Can you hear me? How is it?
Content_zh: Stapley：你能聽到我嗎？怎樣？

Content: Schafer: Yeah. I can hear you, can you hear me?
Content_zh: Schafer：是的。我能聽見你，你能聽見我嗎？

Content: Stapley: Yeah, I can hear you.
Content_zh: Stapley：是的，我能聽見你。

Content: Schafer: Oh, man. I haven't paid my property taxes.
Content_zh: Schafer：哦，天啊。我還沒交房產稅。

Content: So embarrassing.
Content_zh: 太尷尬了。

Content: So one of the main things I want to do is pick what you're going to paint for Lee to mess with in after-effects.
Content_zh: 所以我想做的主要事情之一是選擇你要為Lee在After Effects中處理什麼畫。

Content: Stapley: Yeah. Schafer: Remember that? Stapley: Yeah.
Content_zh: Stapley：是的。Schafer：記得那個嗎？Stapley：是的。

Content: So is that how we're going to do it?
Content_zh: 所以我們要這樣做嗎？

Content: Like I'm thinking of layers basically.
Content_zh: 就像我基本上在想層次。

Content: Petty: The goal is just to get like a type of environment, you know.
Content_zh: Petty：目標只是獲取一種類型的環境，知道的。

Content: Like maybe it looks like something that the player could walk, kind of left or right and have it scroll or into.
Content_zh: 比如說，它看起來像是玩家可以向左或向右行走並滾動進入的東西。

Content: Kind of either one we could explore.
Content_zh: 這兩者之一我們都可以探索。

Content: Schafer: Right now he's taking, you know, Bagel's work and Bagel's not a very technical person
Content_zh: Schafer：現在他正在處理，知道的，Bagel的工作，而Bagel並不是一個非常技術性的人

Content: so he just paints these awesome paintings.
Content_zh: 所以他只是畫這些超棒的畫。

Content: But then making it actually look good in the game is a whole different thing.
Content_zh: 但讓它在遊戲中看起來實際上很好是完全不同的事情。

Content: And so we've got Lee working on actually making that a realized game playing world.
Content_zh: 所以我們有Lee在實際打造那個實現的遊戲世界。

Content: And it's really fun to see them working together, because they're so different but they're putting together this, I think,
Content_zh: 看到他們一起工作真的很有趣，因為他們差異很大，但他們正在組合這個，我認為，

Content: awesome looking visual style.
Content_zh: 令人驚嘆的視覺風格。

Content: Schafer: There's a lot of cabins in here.
Content_zh: Schafer：這裡有很多小屋。

Content: Petty: Hey, that'd be a good one, Tim. That cabin.
Content_zh: Petty：嘿，那會是一個不錯的選擇，Tim。那個小屋。

Content: So if you wanted the player walk into the screen there, like it's a little slightly different
Content_zh: 所以如果你想讓玩家走進那個屏幕，那會有點不同，

Content: but similar to that whole circus sequence in Monkey one.
Content_zh: 但類似於《猴島奇兵》中的整個馬戲團序列。

Content: You just walk into that and they can make a move up to that top shot basically.
Content_zh: 你只需走進去，他們基本上就可以移動到那個頂部拍攝點。

Content: Petty: We haven't designed in the actual characters yet for the game.
Content_zh: Petty：我們尚未為遊戲設計實際的角色。

Content: Tim is still writing and coming up with exactly what the world is.
Content_zh: Tim仍在撰寫並確定世界究竟是什麼。

Content: So we just sort of picked a character out of one of Bagel's sketches and put it into the game.
Content_zh: 所以我們只是從Bagel的一個草圖中挑選了一個角色並將其放入遊戲中。

Content: And we needed to do, you know, we just needed it to move around.
Content_zh: 我們需要做的是，知道的，我們只是需要它移動。

Content: So I just did some really quick animation on it.
Content_zh: 所以我只是對它做了些非常快速的動畫。

Content: It's certainly not great animation but just to get it to kind of move around the world.
Content_zh: 這當然不是很棒的動畫，但只是讓它在世界上移動。

Content: And follow the camera.
Content_zh: 並跟隨攝影機。

Content: And so I think, you know, you kind of get a sense of, is how the camera might follow the player and kind of lag behind the player.
Content_zh: 所以我認為，知道的，你大致上了解了攝影機如何跟隨玩家並稍微落後於玩家。

Content: How it might move around the screen.
Content_zh: 它可能如何在屏幕周圍移動。

Content: And you'll see that one of the things we're doing here with this character is that as he's in this canopy, he's kind of tinted green and darker.
Content_zh: 你會看到我們與這個角色一起做的其中一件事是，當他在這個樹冠中時，他有點被綠色和暗色調染色。

Content: And as he emerges into the sun, here he becomes a little brighter.
Content_zh: 當他走出樹冠進入陽光時，他變得稍微亮一些。

Content: And we don't really have, you know, any true lighting that's going to paint it into the painting,
Content_zh: 我們其實沒有，知道的，任何真正的燈光會將它繪製到畫中，

Content: but I'm doing some simple things where we're using like color gradients based on location of the world and kind of multiplying it in this character.
Content_zh: 但我正在做一些簡單的事情，我們根據世界的位置使用像色彩漸變，並在這個角色上進行乘法。

Content: Just with the goal of getting to feel part of that environment.
Content_zh: 只是為了讓它感覺成為那個環境的一部分。

Content: And that's a type of trick that we could do technically in the game image if we wanted to.
Content_zh: 如果我們想的話，這是一種我們技術上可以在遊戲圖像中做到的技巧。

Content: And it's really quick to do.
Content_zh: 而且這很快就能做到。

Content: But it's enough to help him harmonize with the environment.
Content_zh: 但這足以幫助他與環境和諧相處。

Content: Schafer: Please join me in welcoming Mr. Chris Remo to the company.
Content_zh: Schafer：請與我一起歡迎Chris Remo先生加入公司。

Content: [Applause] Schafer: Remo's our community manager.
Content_zh: [掌聲] Schafer：Remo是我們的社區經理。

Content: He's been here now for two weeks or so, ish.
Content_zh: 他現在在這裡已經兩週左右了，大約。

Content: Chris, could you please stand up.
Content_zh: Chris，你能請站起來嗎。

Content: [Laughter] Any questions about any of that stuff before we talk about projects?
Content_zh: [笑聲] 在我們討論項目之前，有關那些事情有任何問題嗎？

Content: I'll give you the update on Double Fine Adventures, awesome game.
Content_zh: 我會給你們更新一下Double Fine Adventures，這是一款很棒的遊戲。

Content: I'm working on design stuff and we have a team actually working on tools and engine and visual,
Content_zh: 我正在從事設計工作，我們有一個團隊實際上在做工具和引擎以及視覺，

Content: pre-visualization of what the art side will look like.
Content_zh: 視覺化藝術方面將會是什麼樣子。

Content: And I'm putting together one of my deliverables for the milestone, in a couple weeks.
Content_zh: 而且我正在整理我在幾週內為這個里程碑準備的一個交付物。

Content: It's like a story document and stuff.
Content_zh: 這像是一個故事文檔之類的。

Content: And at that point I'll be like probably sharing more info about the game with other people company-wide.
Content_zh: 到那時，我可能會與公司其他人分享更多有關這款遊戲的信息。

Content: Rice: Well I mean, Tim's been doing brainstorming stuff for a while.
Content_zh: Rice：我的意思是，Tim已經做腦力激盪的工作有一段時間了。

Content: And that's still what he's doing, just kind of holing up in his office and figuring out what the game is.
Content_zh: 這仍然是他所做的，只是有點在他的辦公室裡全面思考並弄清楚這個遊戲是什麼。

Content: Schafer: You know, at the very beginning I'm locked in my room a lot writing dialogue.
Content_zh: Schafer：你知道的，最開始時我經常被鎖在我的房間裡寫對話。

Content: But then I kind of have the job of pulling this whole thing down the road.
Content_zh: 但之後我有點像是負責推動整個事情向前發展的工作。

Content: You know, so I was ready to finally pitch to the team.
Content_zh: 你知道的，所以我準備好最終向團隊推銷。

Content: I'm not really, haven't really felt right to pitch to the whole company yet.
Content_zh: 我還沒有真正覺得向整個公司推銷是合適的。

Content: That'll come later but, so I pitched to the whole team.
Content_zh: 那會在後面，但是，所以我向整個團隊推銷了。

Content: Schafer: OK. So I'm going to talk about the game today with everybody.
Content_zh: Schafer：好的。所以我今天要和大家談談這款遊戲。

Content: And some people have heard about it and some people have not.
Content_zh: 有些人聽說過，有些人沒有。

Content: Did I talk to you about the game?
Content_zh: 我有跟你談過這款遊戲嗎？

Content: Some people have not, not just you.
Content_zh: 有些人沒有，不只是你。

Content: [Laughter] Petty: There're several people in Wisconsin.
Content_zh: [笑聲] Petty：威斯康星州有幾個人。

Content: Schafer: As you see, I've made a lot of progress.
Content_zh: Schafer：如你所見，我已經取得了很多進展。

Content: I've designed some monster designs. Rice: I like it.
Content_zh: 我設計了一些怪物設計。Rice：我喜歡。

Content: Schafer: And then I was going to go and do some detail about some ideas for the beginning of one side of the story.
Content_zh: Schafer：然後我打算去詳細說明故事一側開始的一些想法。

Content: Just 'cause the first example, like a sample game play and then we can all tear it apart
Content_zh: 只是因為第一個例子，比如一個遊戲試玩樣本，然後我們都可以拆解它

Content: and talk about how it's never, never, never going to work.
Content_zh: 並討論它怎麼可能永遠不會運作。

Content: Schafer: And it's an interesting process where...
Content_zh: Schafer：這是一個有趣的過程，

Content: deciding when to solicit feedback and when to actually sell.
Content_zh: 決定何時徵求反饋，何時實際銷售。

Content: It's like sometimes you're selling and sometimes looking for feedback.
Content_zh: 這就像有時你在銷售，有時你在尋求反饋。

Content: And the idea... And early on I could sense like in the meeting, 'cause we talked about that as being a feedback session about the pitch and stuff.
Content_zh: 而這個想法……早期我能感覺到，在會議中，因為我們談論過這是關於推銷的反饋會議等等。

Content: I realized I didn't want any feedback right then, like any in-depth feedback.
Content_zh: 我意識到我當時不想要任何反饋，比如任何深入的反饋。

Content: So I kind of pitched the game and then kind of moved the meeting forward and ended it and because there is an early stage
Content_zh: 所以我有點推銷了遊戲，然後有點推進了會議並結束了，因為有一個早期階段

Content: where you don't want any feedback because it doesn't really mean anything.
Content_zh: 在那個階段你不想要任何反饋，因為它實際上沒有什麼意義。

Content: Because they don't know still entirely what you're thinking and they might have an image in their head
Content_zh: 因為他們還不完全知道你在想什麼，他們的腦海中可能有一個形象

Content: but it probably isn't exactly like what I have in my head.
Content_zh: 但這可能並不完全像我腦海中的那樣。

Content: So I almost don't want their opinion of it because they're not talking about the thing I'm talking about.
Content_zh: 所以我幾乎不想要他們的意見，因為他們沒有談論我在談論的事情。

Content: They're talking about their own, how they see it.
Content_zh: 他們在談論他們自己的，如何看待它。

Content: Offscreen Voice: Can I contribute as a devil's advocate?
Content_zh: 螢幕外的聲音：我可以作為魔鬼的代言人提供意見嗎？

Content: Schafer: I like where this is going.
Content_zh: Schafer：我喜歡這個方向。

Content: Remo: To me the strongest parts of this by far are the thematic aspects of the two characters in parallel.
Content_zh: Remo：對我來說，這個最強的部分無疑是兩個角色的主題方面並行發展。

Content: Especially switching between those, I think, could be incredibly important and really, really cool.
Content_zh: 尤其是在它們之間切換，我認為，可能是非常重要且非常酷。

Content: Both in terms of game play and aesthetics and the stuff supporting that seems so high-concept to me that it might end up being top-heavy.
Content_zh: 無論是遊戲玩法還是美學，以及支持這些的東西對我來說看起來都非常高概念，可能最終會過於重量級。

Content: Like it seems, it just seems like a really complicated thing.
Content_zh: 就像它看起來，它只是看起來像一個非常複雜的事情。

Content: Schafer: People at, you know, at that meeting can bring up any sort of problems but it's just too early, you know.
Content_zh: Schafer：你知道的，在那個會議上，人們可以提出任何類型的問題，但現在還太早了，你知道的。

Content: I dare them. Nice try, Chris Remo.
Content_zh: 我敢挑戰他們。好嘗試，Chris Remo。

Content: What were we thinking inviting that guy to the meeting?
Content_zh: 我們邀請那個人到會議是在想什麼？

Content: Hey, maybe this thing you're doing shouldn't be done. Thanks.
Content_zh: 嘿，也許你正在做的這件事不應該做。謝謝。

Content: Remo: That's... I mean...
Content_zh: Remo：那是……我的意思是……

Content: Schafer: I guess because I see it working in my head, it isn't that complicated.
Content_zh: Schafer：我猜是因為我在腦海中看到它在運作，並不那麼複雜。

Content: I see that being like just providing a structure, actually, to how everything has to behave.
Content_zh: 我看到這就像是實際上為一切必須如何行為提供一個結構。

Content: Schafer: I do want is like when I say the idea, what other ideas that makes that person think of.
Content_zh: Schafer：我希望的是，當我提出這個想法，這會讓那個人想到哪些其他的想法。

Content: Like you know what would be cool? And how they want to add to it.
Content_zh: 比如說，知道什麼會很酷？以及他們如何想要添加到這其中。

Content: Petty: I love hearing new ideas.
Content_zh: Petty：我喜歡聽到新想法。

Content: I like, Tim is a very, a lot of times Tim, the way he describes ideas is like, like the fact he described a box cover for a game
